sentences.sContent: Many innocent civilians were killed during the war.
sentences.sCn: 许多无辜的平民在战争中丧生。

sentences.sContent: It was difficult to return to civilian life after ten years in the military.
sentences.sCn: 从军十年后重新过平民生活不容易。

sentences.sContent: ...Scholars warn that Antarctica’s political drift could blur the distinction between military and civilian activities long before the continent’s treaties come up for renegotiation...

phrases.pCn: 平民伤亡；平民死伤；民众伤亡

trans.tranOther: anyone who is not a member of the military forces or the police
used to describe people or things that are not military
